name: markdown-fiction-writer
description: Tools for writing fiction. Improves writing flow with exporting, formatting, easy editing, dialogue syntax, highlighting, file tagging, document statistics.

viewsWelcome.contents:
Press refresh button to compute word-gram frequencies for current file.
[Refresh](command:fiction-writer.extension.wordFrequency.refresh)

Press refresh button to compute statistics for current file.
[Refresh](command:fiction-writer.extension.statistics.refresh)

fictionWriter.edit.disableKeybindings.markdownDescription:
Disable editor keybindings added by this extension (`enter`, `shift+enter`, `delete`, `backspace`, `tab`).

**Note:** If `disabled`, some of the settings will not work.



[Open Online Documentation](https://zoctarine.github.io/vscode-fiction-writer/edit/)

fictionWriter.edit.easyParagraphCreation.markdownDescription: A new paragraph (two line breaks) will be created when pressing:
markdownEnumDescriptions:
- `enter` will add two line-breaks.

- `shift`+`enter` will add one line-break.

- `enter` will add one line-break.

- `shift`+`enter` will add two line-breaks.

fictionWriter.editDialogue.marker.markdownDescription: Controls what punctuation is used when dialogue.
enum: -- Hello, (two dashes followed by one space)
--- Hello, (three dashes followed by one space)
markdownEnumDescriptions:
Em-dash followed by one space: 

 — Hello, John said.

Two dashes followed by one space: 

 -- Hello, John said.

Three dashes followed by one space: 

 --- Hello, John said.

Two dashes, no space: 

 --Hello, John said.

Three dashes, no space: 

 ---Hello, John said.

fictionWriter.editDialogue.markerAutoRep.markdownDescription: If anything other than `quotes` is selected, it automatically replaces the `-- ` text at the begining of a new line, with the selected marker.

fictionWriter.editDialogue.sentenceInden.markdownDescription: Indent for sequential lines of the same dialogue paragraph. (`0` for no indenting)
Sets the line indent from the same dialogue paragraph equal with the selected `#fictionWriter.editDialogue.marker#`.

fictionWriter.view.wordWrapIndent.markdownDescription:
The hanging indent of wrapped lines.

**Select:**
- `0` for same indent as first line,
- `-1` for now wrapping indent,
- any other value for hanging indent.



_**Warning:** Only works if `#editor.wordWrap#` is enabled, and might change the `#editor.tabSize#` setting for `markdown`._

fictionWriter.view.foldParagraphLines.description: Show folding marker for paragraphs with multiple lines. (soft-breaks)

fictionWriter.view.highlight.textBetween.markdownDescription: Highlights all text between quotes. Usefull for highlighting dialogues (if quoted syntax is used)

fictionWriter.view.highlight.dialogueMar.markdownDescription: Highlights the dialogue markers (---, --, — or quote marks symbols).

fictionWriter.textFormatting.enabled.markdownDescription:
This is feature is **EXPERIMENTAL**. Make sure make a backup before trying it out.

If enabled, it formats document using the selected formatters. Formatting is available with `Format Document` command..

[Open Online Documentation](https://zoctarine.github.io/vscode-fiction-writer/format/

fictionWriter.textFormatting.fixMismatch.markdownDescription: If `#fictionWriter.editDialogue.marker#` is not quotes, replaces mismatched markers with current selected marker.

fictionWriter.textFormatting.fixDialogue.markdownDescription: If `#fictionWriter.editDialogue.marker#` is not quotes, and `#fictionWriter.editDialogue.sentenceIndent#` is enabled, reformats dialogue indents to selected dialogue indent.

fictionWriter.textFormatting.fixParagrap.markdownDescription: Normalizes space between different paragraph types (header, body, dialogue, ...).

fictionWriter.textFormatting.removeExtra.markdownDescription: Replaces multiple consecutive spaces with one single space. (not from begining or ending of line)
Reduces multiple empty lines (more than two), to a single empty line.

fictionWriter.textFormatting.removeTrail.markdownDescription: Remove all whitespace characters from line ends.

fictionWriter.textFormatting.fixParagrap.markdownDescription: Controls how paragraph breaks and soft line breaks will be formatted.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Transforms each soft line-break to a new paragraph.
Merges soft line-break lines into same paragraph line.
Splits lines into sentences. Each sentence is on a separate line.

fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.colors.markdownDescription: Defines a keyword (**Item**) and associate a color (**Value**) to it. The colors can be visible in **Metadata** view or **Explorer** view.

fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.colorsIn.markdownDescription:
Use [Keyword Colors](#fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.colors) as icon colors in **Metadata** view.

_**Note:** if no icon is set/visible, then the color will not be visible._

Use [Keyword Colors](#fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.colors) in **Explorer** view.

 _**Note:** Only the `first matched keyword` will be considered_

_**Note:** file colors can be ovewritten by other extensions, so they might not show as expected._

_**Also:** `#explorer.decorations.colors#` must be `enabled`._

fictionWriter.metadata.categories.icons.markdownDescription:
Assign for each metadata category (**Item**) a vscode icon (**Value**)

_**Note:** You can use any icon from [Product Icon Reference](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/icons-in-labels#icon-listing)._

fictionWriter.metadata.categories.showNa.markdownDescription: If `disabled`, it hides category name in **Metadata View** for 1st level categories only.

fictionWriter.metadata.easyLists.markdownDescription:
Metadata values separated by this string, will be treated as list items.

Enter the list item separator character below _(or leave it empty to disable this feature)_:

_**Example:** `item1, item2, item three` will be equivalent to `[item1, item2, item three]` if the separator is comma (`,`)._

fictionWriter.metadata.categories.summar.markdownDescription:
If `enabled`, it will show the contents of the `summary` 1st level category in the _message_ section of the  **Metadata View**, and not in the tree itself.

 To use it, simply define a metadata block:

`---`

**`summary: The document summary`**

`---`

fictionWriter.metadata.enabled.markdownDescription:
It enables metadata reltated features. If `disabled` then **all** metadata related featueres will be disabled (parsing, metadata view, colors, etc...).

[Open Online Documentation](https://zoctarine.github.io/vscode-fiction-writer/metadata/)

fictionWriter.metadata.categories.defaul.markdownDescription:
Assigning keywords to this category, if none is specified.

For example, if default category is `tags`, then the metadata block:

`---`

**`draft, ch1`**

`---`

 is equivalent to:

`---`

_`tags`_`: `**`draft, ch1`**

`---`

fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.colorsCa.markdownDescription:
Uses only this category when resolving **Explorer** colors. _(leave empty to do a full metadata search)_

_**Note:** the `first matched keyword` in this category will dictate the color._

fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.badgesCa.markdownDescription:
Uses only this category when resolving **Explorer** badges. _(leave empty to do a full metadata search)_

_**Note:** the `first matched keyword` in this category will dictate the badge._

fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.badges.markdownDescription:
Keyword badges are 1 or 2 letter abreviations of the keywords that appear in file explorer next to the filename.

***Example:*** For a file containing the metadata block:

`---`

**`Status: draft, ch1`**

`---`

 and, if for `draft` keyword you set `D` badge, then the file will apear in **Explorer** as:

`yourFileName.md D`

fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.badgesIn.markdownDescription:
Show [Keyword Badges](#fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.badges) in **Explorer** view.

 _**Note:** Only the first matched keyword will be considered._

fictionWriter.metadata.colors.mappings.markdownDescription: Defines a keyword (**Item**) and associate a color (**Value**) to it. The colors can be visible in **Metadata** view or **Explorer** view.

showInExplorer.description: Show Metadaata Colors in File Explorer

showInMetadataView.description: Show Metadata Colors in Metadata View

fictionWriter.metadata.colors.enabled.markdownDescription:
Use [Keyword Colors](#fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.colors) as icon colors in **Metadata** view.

_**Note:** if no icon is set/visible, then the color will not be visible._

fictionWriter.metadata.icons.mappings.markdownDescription:
Assign for each metadata category (**Item**) a vscode icon (**Value**)

_**Note:** You can use any icon from [Product Icon Reference](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/icons-in-labels#icon-listing)._

showInMetadataView.description: Show Category icons in Metadata View

fictionWriter.metadata.badges.mappings.markdownDescription:
Keyword badges are 1 or 2 letter abreviations of the keywords that appear in file explorer next to the filename.

***Example:*** For a file containing the metadata block:

`---`

**`Status: draft, ch1`**

`---`

 and, if for `draft` keyword you set `D` badge, then the file will apear in **Explorer** as:

`yourFileName.md D`

showInExplorer.description: Show Metadata Badges in File Explorer

fictionWriter.metadata.badges.enabled.markdownDescription:
Show [Keyword Badges](#fictionWriter.metadata.keywords.badges) in **Explorer** view.

 _**Note:** Only the first matched keyword will be considered._

fictionWriter.notes.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enables the notes view, that recognizes (and groups) `.txt` files together with `.md` and metadata files.

[Open Online Documentation](https://zoctarine.github.io/vscode-fiction-writer/notes/)

fictionWriter.notes.defaultText.markdownDescription:
The default text for all new note files.

Add each line as a new _item_.

fictionWriter.splitDocument.switchToNewl.markdownDescription: When splitting a document, immediately open (and switch to) the newly created doument in the text editor.

fictionWriter.smartRename.enabled.markdownDescription: If enabled, allows batch operations on related files (eg. `.md`, `.md.yml` and `.md.txt`)

markdownEnumDescriptions: Will always rename/move `.yml` and `.md` files with same name, together.
For each rename/move operation, Will ask if `.yml` and `.md` files with same name are found on disk.
fictionWriter.smartRename.renameRelatedF.markdownDescription: If `enabled`, renames/moves related (`.yml` and `.md`) files together.

fictionWriter.export.include.enabled.markdownDescription: If `enabled`, the `{DOCUMENT_ID}` or `{document/file/path/filename.md}` syntax can be used to include on `.md` file into another file

fictionWriter.export.include.searchDocum.markdownDescription: When including files, search `{DOCUMENT_ID}` in all opened files and workspace folders. If `disabled`, it only searches in the workspace folder that the document belongs to.

fictionWriter.export.outputFormat.defaul.markdownDescription:
The output document format.

**Important:** This requires having [Pandoc](https://pandoc.org/installing.html) installed on your system, and available to be run from commandline.

fictionWriter.export.outputFormat.always.markdownDescription:
Select the output format each time an export command is run.

If set to `false`, the selected `#fictionWriter.export.outputFormat.default#` will be used.

markdownEnumDescriptions: The Save File Dialogue is shown every time an export command is run.
Never show the Save File Dialogue. The exported document will be saved in the same directory with the source document(s).
fictionWriter.export.showSaveDialogue.markdownDescription: Control when the Save File Dialogue is shown.

fictionWriter.export.outputTemplate.enab.markdownDescription: If enabled, the template file selected at `#fictionWriter.export.outputTemplate.file#` will be used when exporting to `docx` or `odt` formats.

fictionWriter.export.outputTemplate.file.markdownDescription:
The output template to be used when exporting to `docx` or `odt`.

**Note:** the template file extension must match the output type. It can be an absolut path, or relative to exported document.

fictionWriter.export.tocFilename.markdownDescription: The filename compiled by **Compile TOC command.**.

fictionWriter.export.smartDeshes.markdownDescription:
Converts `--` to `em-dash` (—) character in exported output. If not selected, it will default to `en-dash` (–).

Is PanDoc `+old_dashes` markdown extension.

fictionWriter.export.skipCodeComments.markdownDescription: When parsing `.md` files, skips lines starting with `//`.

fictionWriter.writingMode.theme.markdownDescription: The theme to be used in Writing Mode. _(leave empty for no theme switch)_

fictionWriter.writingMode.fontSize.markdownDescription: The font size to be used in Writing Mode.

fictionWriter.writingMode.toggleFocusMod.description: When entering Writing Mode, it fades out all text except current text line (known as Focus Mode)

fictionWriter.view.focusMode.opacity.description: Opacity for fade out text when focus mode is enabled.
fictionWriter.view.focusMode.opacity.markdownDescription: Opacity for fade out text when focus mode is enabled.

fictionWriter.view.focusMode.highlightTy.description: Controls what portion of the text gets highlighted. Focus on:

fictionWriter.statusBar.enabled.markdownDescription: Show the custom **Fiction Writer** status bar

fictionWriter.statusBar.items.markdownDescription: `show`/`hide` items on the **Fiction Writer** status bar
